title.value: Assessing Intrapartum Risk of Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy Using Fetal Heart Rate with Long Short-Term Memory Networks
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Assessing Intrapartum Risk of Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy Using Fetal Heart Rate with Long Short-Term Memory Networks

extractions.description: This study investigates using a long short-term memory (LSTM) recurrent neural network to predict the risk of hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy (HIE) during labor using cardiotocography records. The results indicate an increase in HIE sensitivity as delivery approaches, though the performance requires improvement. Future work intends to explore additional network architectures and signal transformations.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results on predicting the risk of HIE using cardiotocography data and LSTM networks, which indicates it is an empirical study.
type.quote: This study investigated the prediction of the risk of hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy using intrapartum cardiotocography records with a long short-term memory recurrent neural network.

name.justification: The paper focuses on using deep learning techniques to assess medical conditions (HIE) from health data (cardiotocography).
name.quote: The study investigated the prediction of the risk of hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy using intrapartum cardiotocography records with a long short-term memory recurrent neural network.

name.justification: The study employs long short-term memory networks which are a type of deep learning model.
name.quote: This study investigated the prediction of the risk of hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy using intrapartum cardiotocography records with a long short-term memory recurrent neural network.

name.justification: The paper is about predicting the risk of HIE using cardiotocography data.
name.quote: The results show that classification improves as delivery approaches but that performance needs improvement.

name.justification: The paper analyzes cardiotocography data which is time-series in nature to predict risks.
name.quote: The classification performance for each segment separately in terms of the average, across folds, of the sensitivity, specificity, and area under the receiver operating characteristic (AUROC) as functions of labour time.

name.justification: The study specifically utilized an LSTM network to predict HIE risk from cardiotocography records.
name.quote: This study investigated the prediction of the risk of hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy using intrapartum cardiotocography records with a long short-term memory recurrent neural network.

is_contributed.justification: LSTM is a well-established model and not introduced in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: This study...using...a long short-term memory recurrent neural network.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes the execution and results of the LSTM model for prediction.
is_executed.quote: sensitivity remained approximately constant with a mean of 0.71 and standard deviation of 0.04.

is_compared.justification: There is no mention of comparative numerical evaluations with other models.
is_compared.quote: The results show that classification improves as delivery approaches but that performance needs improvement.

referenced_paper_title.value: Intrapartum fetal-state classification using long short-term memory neural networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to Warrick and Hamilton's work suggests this paper as the source for LSTM in this context.
referenced_paper_title.quote: [11] Warrick PA, Hamilton EF. Intrapartum fetal-state classification using long short-term memory neural networks.

name.value: Kaiser Permanente Northern California CTG Dataset
name.justification: The dataset used for the study is explicitly described as CTG signals from Kaiser Permanente Northern California.
name.quote: The clinical data comprised 12 hours of de-identified CTG signals obtained from 246,973 births at the 15 hospitals of Kaiser Permanente Northern California between 2010 and 2019.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is a collection of signals from a specific hospital system and doesn't have a referenced paper title; it's described in the methodology.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The clinical data comprised 12 hours of de-identified CTG signals obtained from 246,973 births at the 15 hospitals of Kaiser Permanente Northern California between 2010 and 2019.

name.justification: The paper mentions using PeriCALM Patterns for preprocessing the input data.
name.quote: We used PeriCALM Patterns, proprietary software from PeriGen Inc., to identify artifacts, remove noise and repair the FHR signals.

referenced_paper_title.value: Neural network based detection of fetal heart rate patterns
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper by Warrick et al. discusses the use of neural networks in this context, suggesting its connection to PeriCALM Patterns.
referenced_paper_title.quote: [15] Warrick P, Hamilton E, Macieszczak M. Neural network based detection of fetal heart rate patterns.
